content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a Julia function that accomplishes this:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_text *=(" " * word)
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

# Test the function
println(wrap_string("This is a test of the wrap string function. Make sure the words are wrapped correctly."))
```

In this code, `split(text)` is used to split the input text into words. Then, for each word, the code checks if adding that word to the current line would make the line too long. If it would, it starts a new line. After adding each word, the length of the current line is updated accordingly. Finally, the wrapped text is returned. The `println` at the end test the function with a given string.
